definition: zero defect/faultless/impeccable

zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
deficiency/lack/scarce/vacant post/to run short of

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Our company must accomplish the requirement of zero defect and stability for the customers.
sentences.chinese: 以达到客户零缺点和稳定性之要求。

sentences.english: To deliver defect-free, competitive products and services to our customer on time.
sentences.chinese: 将零缺点且具有竞争力的产品和服务准时送达。

definition: perfect and without blemish/flawless/to leave nothing to be desired
excellent in every respect/flawless
perfectionist
perfect (idiom); perfection/the best of all possible worlds/as good as it gets
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
the customer reigns supreme (idiom)
defective/imperfect
perfect/perfection/perfectly
(idiom) impossible to fault/impeccable
complete and beautiful/to be perfect (idiom)
nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
to follow through/to carry through to the end
(Tw) (coll.) indecisive/fussy/nitpicking/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [ku-moo])
loved by all/to have universal appeal
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
lit. in the eyes of a lover appears 西施[Xi1 shi1] (idiom); fig. beauty is in the eye of the beholder
